text: [Music]
the rad lab is a collection of people
who are rallying around this vision of
allowing a single person to create the
next great internet service the feedback
we got was these ideas look interesting
but you're only running on clusters of
10 servers you have to show scalability
it's not clear why the power should be
in it we' heard about cloud Computing
and that seemed the only plausible
viable approach so we approached Amazon
about using their services amazingly
within 6 months we had one of the first
papers from a research group using a
thousand computers and that was done via
Amazon you had left comments uh I think
as Educators were excited about cloud
computing because all of a sudden we can
give students much more realistic and
compelling homework and lab assignments
we can have students program their own
high performance parallel server we can
have them watch a database tip over when
web service gets heavily loaded and
those things would have required
hundreds of computers uh which is just
untenable without something like cloud
computing to help us out and for 2 hours
you get 100 machines and you can run
experiments on them you shut off the
machines you look at your data and then
you can come back the next day again get
100 more machines and you know run your
stuff on it you don't have to worry
about the details of you know setting up
a cluster and managing it and you know
breaking down and all the costs of that
what makes the partnership between UC
Berkley and Amazon so valuable is that
from the Amazon side they get a very
early look at emerging applications and
emerging needs from the Berkeley side we
get access to resources that would be
extremely difficult and extremely
expensive for us to build out provision
and maintain so that when our students
and our researchers need access to
Industrial scale resources they can get
them on demand when students now go out
into the workforce or or continue their
graduate careers they actually have
experiences that much closer to what
industry is is hoping and expecting to
see in top graduates than what we could
have done using only our local resources
based on our success with the rad lab
we've uh decided to launch another
5-year uh research effort the new effort
is uh called the amp lab where amp
stands for algorithms machines and
people and the goal of the amp lab is to
uh investigate making sense of the world
at scale our mission is really to
deliver the best education and the best
research experience to our students and
cloud computing has made a qualitative
difference in how we can do that
